column5: When you've unhooked the fish, you could have a small catapult to launch them over the front and into the water.  http://www.king5.com/story/news/local/2015/03/05/brandons-labor-of-love/24479259/

Not so unusual or different. Mini battleships have been afloat and fighting battles in England for decades. You sit directly within the superstructure controlling vessel and guns/catapults. Someone onshore controls the R/C aircraft.

Not so unusual or different. Mini battleships have been afloat and fighting battles in England for decades. You sit directly within the superstructure controlling vessel and guns/catapults. Someone onshore controls the R/C aircraft.  Yeah, I've seen those. There are also miniature lake freighters used to train crew.
Great job on building that carrier, now he just has to brush up on his landing skills a bit
